term 0.0.1
  • Reference
  • Changelog

term

term is an R package to create, manipulate and query S3 vectors of parameter terms such as ‘alpha’, ‘beta[3]’ and ‘sigma2[1,4]’.

Installation

To install the latest release version from CRAN

install.packages("term")

To install the latest development version from GitHub

# install.packages("remotes")
remotes::install_github("poissonconsulting/term")

Demonstration

library(term)

# a term vector can be created from a character vector
term <- as.term(c("sigma", "beta[2,2]", "alpha[1]", "alpha[2]", "beta[1,1]", 
                  "beta[2,1]", "beta[1,2]"))

print(term)
#> [1] "sigma"     "beta[2,2]" "alpha[1]"  "alpha[2]"  "beta[1,1]" "beta[2,1]"
#> [7] "beta[1,2]"

# term vectors can be sorted (by the term parameter names and indices)
term <- sort(term)
print(term)
#> [1] "alpha[1]"  "alpha[2]"  "beta[1,1]" "beta[2,1]" "beta[1,2]" "beta[2,2]"
#> [7] "sigma"

# and the parameters extracted
parameters(term)
#> [1] "alpha" "beta"  "sigma"

# as well as the dimensions of each parameter
pdims(term)
#> $alpha
#> [1] 2
#> 
#> $beta
#> [1] 2 2
#> 
#> $sigma
#> [1] 1

# and the index of each term
tindex(term)
#> $`alpha[1]`
#> [1] 1
#> 
#> $`alpha[2]`
#> [1] 2
#> 
#> $`beta[1,1]`
#> [1] 1 1
#> 
#> $`beta[2,1]`
#> [1] 2 1
#> 
#> $`beta[1,2]`
#> [1] 1 2
#> 
#> $`beta[2,2]`
#> [1] 2 2
#> 
#> $sigma
#> [1] 1
